page.title: 16SHIPDHAM PEOPLE INTERVIEWS 2
page.content: {CHAIRMAN OF THE PARISH COUNCIL }We discussed some of the problems in the village. Street lights needed new switches and would each cost Â£25 to repair. The council also had to contact other organisations about road repairs, pot holes had been the most recent problem. Conservation of footpaths was an important issue. The Council usually have monthly meetings. Some problems get passed onto{ {Breckland District Council.}The Chairman preferred to has meetings with people rather than telephone or write. Sometimes meetings could take 4 hours.{A COACH PROPRIETOR}told us that he started work at 6.30a.m. and finished often at 7.00p.m. He drove on average 1000 miles per week. Paper work was part of the job that he disliked but repairs to the coaches was his favourite job.
